data.headline: Stocks open lower as hawkish Fed minutes and a widening trade deficit weigh on sentiment while oil and gold rally on Middle East tensions
bullets: S&P 500 fell 0.3%, Dow dropped 0.4%, Nasdaq lost 0.5%, and Russell 2000 declined 0.6% in broad risk-off trade
Fed minutes signaled a divided, hawkish stance, curbing hopes for near-term rate cuts
December trade deficit widened to $70.3B, one of the largest annual gaps since 1960, overshadowing resilient jobless claims
Escalating US-Iran tensions pushed oil to six-month highs, boosting energy and gold sectors
Tech stocks came under pressure following Nvidia’s recent AI-driven surge
Walmart slumped 3–4% on mixed results and cautious long-term EPS guidance, dragging major indices
Carvana plunged post-earnings, while DoorDash, Deere, Quanta Services, and Etsy rallied
Wayfair and Stellantis declined amid mixed corporate results
Traders are closely watching Middle East developments and tomorrow’s Q4 GDP data for the next market catalyst
